_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Valero Renewable Fuels, LLC is committed to the protection of our employees, the public and the environment.  This is demonstrated through our prevention program which covers areas such as operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with regulated substances.  Valero Renewable Fuels, LLC carries a written emergency response plan to assist with accidental releases of hazardous materials. This plan includes all aspects of emergency response including evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident procedures.

Processes and Regulated Substances 
Valero Renewable Fuels, LLC operates an ethanol fuel production plant located Aurora, South Dakota. The facility produces fuel grade ethanol from corn and processes by-products known as dry and wet distillers' grain with solubles, which is used as a livestock feed. The fuel ethanol production process requires use of a denaturant (natural gasoline) which may contain approximately 40 percent pentane, an RMP regulated
substance. The maximum amount of natural gasoline on-site is estimated to be 1,268,000 pounds (total pentane is 507,200 pounds). The natural gasoline is stored in an above ground tank as a liquid and is added to the ethanol to make the ethanol unfit for human consumption. Anhydrous ammonia is also stored on-site and used in the ethanol production process for pH control. The maximum anhydrous ammonia stored will be
100,800 pounds.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps 
Our facility has taken necessary steps to meet EPA requirements under 40 CFR Part 68 as well as Process Safety Management requirement under OSHA. Written procedures are in place at Valero Renewables to manage change in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures. Process Operators, Maintenance personnel, or any other employee whose job tasks are affected

by a modification in process conditions are notified and trained to ensure awareness of the modification. Our facility also maintains written operating procedures of covered process; these procedures address various modes of operation such as emergency and normal operations, shutdown and start-up after a turnaround. Valero Renewables has a comprehensive training program in place which covers many topics, such as Emergency Response and Hazardous Communication. Our facilities Mechanical Integrity programs details maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations.  

Five Year Accident History
Valero Renewable Fuels, LLC  does not have a history of accidents which may have caused death, injuries, environmental or property damage, evacuations or in-place sheltering in the last five years.

Commitment to Improved Safety
Safety Committee meetings, monthly safety training, operator training and certification are some of the major steps we are taking to improve safety at our facility.
